title: Enough as an adjective and adverb

exercises.title: Enough As An Adjective And An Adverb

questions.question: I didn’t get …………………… to finish the report.
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: She doesn’t have …………………………. to buy an apartment.
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: His work was not ……………………………
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: I couldn’t answer ……………………………. to pass the exam.
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: Have you bought ……………………………….?
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: She doesn’t have …………………………. in the city.
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: The boy is not ………………………… to take care of his little sister.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: She has ………………………….. to be a good teacher.
The water wasn’t ………………………….. for a swim.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He was ………………………….. to help me.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He is not ………………………….. to be a wrestler.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He is …………………………… to solve any puzzle.
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective or adverb, it goes after that adjective or adverb.
